page.title: 03INLAND WATER,RIVER,PONDS.
page.content: {ECOLOGY, GRT CANFIELD,}page2 of 3 Inland water. {RIVERS.} There is one small river, the Roding, a tributary of the Thames. It supports much wild life - heron, kingfisher, mussels and fish. {PONDS.}There are several ponds, mostly in association with farms. One pond near Fitzjohns, is the home of a pair of mute swans. { {RESERVOIR. }A private reservoir of just over 3 acres was constructed on New Hall Farm in 1984. Water is pumped into it during the winter from a tributary of the river Roding. The water is used in summer for irrigation of crops particularly potatoes and rape.
